knimeNode.name: Minimum Spanning Tree Clustering
knimeNode.shortDescription: Uses Prim’s algorithm to build a minimum spanning tree for each cluster, stopping when the nearest- * nneighbour distance rises above a specified threshold. Returns a set of clusters and a set of ’outliers’ not in any cluster.

fullDescription.intro:
Uses Prim’s algorithm to build a minimum spanning tree for each cluster, stopping when the nearest- * nneighbour distance rises above a specified threshold. Returns a set of clusters and a set of ’outliers’ not in any cluster.

tab.name: Standard Options
tab.option: Filtering of data matrix or data frame. Each row must correspond to an observation, and each column must correspond to a variable. All variables must be numeric. Missing values (NAs) are allowed.
Threshold for stopping the tree building within a cluster. The tree stops when the squared euclidean distance to the closest point to the tree is greater than this.

tab.name: Advanced Options
tab.option: Stop when the clusters make up this fraction of the data.
Stop when fewer than this many pairs have nearest-neighbor distance less than threshold.
Integer index to start the minimum spanning tree at this observation.
If FALSE, use NA for the cluster identifier for outliers.
